habitat_description:
This species is distributed in south central Arizona and south to west Sonora in Mexico. In Arizona, the Sonoran green toad can be found from Santa Rosa Wash in Pinal County, and Organ Pipe Cactus National Monument to the proximity of the San Xavier Mission in Pima County. Hybrids with the red-spotted toad are reported in the vicinity of Quijotoa in Pima County (Stebbins 2003). Range may be increasing northward following irrigated lands (Lannoo 2005).

Found in bajadas, valleys, and plains of the Lower Colorado Desertscrub, Arizona Upland Desertscrub, and Semidesert Grassland (Brennan and Holycross 2009).Strongly associated semiarid grasslands with upland saguaro-palo verde communities, creosote bush flats, and mesquite grassland. Breeding takes place in water accumulated from rains in wash bottoms surrounded by scattered shrubs and fresh grass; temporary pools, cattle tanks, and washes (Behler and King 1979; Brennan and Holycross 2009; Stebbins 2003). Breeding occurs in temporary pools formed in rainwater sumps, wash bottoms, and roadside ditches (Stebbins 1985).
